content: up 17 sts one from the main colour and the other 16 from the heel flap k one round you should have 78 82 86 92 sts across four needles set up row k to marker either side is fine i also move the progress keeper here to remind me when to note i usually have 14 15 16 18 sts across the bottom of the foot and the top mark the new bor of the foot and then 25 26 27 28 on either side this may involve moving sts round 1 *k1 ssk k to 2 sts before the other side of the sock k2tog* across the different needles but will help with then only needing to count the sts repeat once more on either side for the foot decreases round 2 k add your progress keeper to the right side of the heel this will mark your new repeat the above two row until you have 24 sts in total bor move the stitches across two needles 12 on the top and 12 on the bottom round 1 k to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 sm k across to next marker removing the stitch markers sm k1 ssk k to end round 2 k to marker sm work the front of the sock in pattern sm k to cut the yarn leaving 12 inches length then close the toe using kitchener stitch end repeat this pattern for the second sock repeat the above two twos until you have 58 60 64 72 spread evenly across four dpns 14 15 16 18 per needle note if you set up the needles as i mention on the start of the foot decreases you will only need to check the side of the foot
